results.definition: native Eurasian tree widely cultivated in many varieties for its firm rounded edible fruits
fruit with red or yellow or green skin and sweet to tart crisp whitish flesh

:3.46}person who holds Ph.D. degree (or the equivalent) from an academic institution
examples: she is a doctor of philosophy in physics

examples.definition: (Roman Catholic Church) a title conferred on 33 saints who distinguished themselves through the orthodoxy of their theological teaching
alter and make impure, as with the intention to deceive
children take the roles of physician or patient or nurse and pretend they are at the physician's office
examples: the children explored each other's bodies by playing the game of doctor

examples.definition: give medical treatment to

examples: the runner was out on a play by the shortstop

examples.definition: engage in recreational activities rather than work; occupy oneself in a diversion
examples: On weekends I play

examples.definition: cause to emit recorded audio or video
examples: I'll play you my favorite record
He never tires of playing that video

examples.definition: movement or space for movement
examples: there was too much play in the steering wheel

examples.definition: behave carelessly or indifferently
the removal of constraints
examples: they gave full play to the artist's talent

examples.definition: engage in an activity as if it were a game rather than take it seriously
examples: They played games on their opponents
play the stock market
play with her feelings

examples.definition: the act of playing for stakes in the hope of winning (including the payment of a price for a chance to win a prize)
examples: there was heavy play at the blackjack table

examples.definition: verbal wit or mockery (often at another's expense but not to be taken seriously)
(in games or plays or other performances) the time during which play proceeds
examples: rain stopped play in the 4th inning

examples.definition: play a role or part
examples: Gielgud played Hamlet
She played the servant to her husband's master

examples.definition: act or have an effect in a specified way or with a specific effect or outcome
examples: This factor played only a minor part in his decision
This development played into her hands
I played no role in your dismissal

examples.definition: a preset plan of action in team sports
examples: the coach drew up the plays for her team

examples.definition: a state in which action is feasible
examples: the ball was still in play
insiders said the company's stock was in play

examples.definition: a theatrical performance of a drama
examples: the play lasted two hours

examples.definition: be at play; be engaged in playful activity; amuse oneself in a way characteristic of children
examples: The kids were playing outside all day
I used to play with trucks as a little girl

examples.definition: behave in a certain way
examples: play safe
play it safe
play fair

examples.definition: be performed or presented for public viewing
examples: What's playing in the local movie theater?
`Cats' has been playing on Broadway for many years

examples.definition: bet or wager (money)
examples: He played $20 on the new horse
She plays the races

examples.definition: cause to move or operate freely within a bounded space
examples: The engine has a wheel that is playing in a rack

examples.definition: discharge or direct or be discharged or directed as if in a continuous stream
examples: play water from a hose
The fountains played all day

examples.definition: emit recorded sound
examples: The tape was playing for hours
the stereo was playing Beethoven when I entered

examples.definition: employ in a game or in a specific position
examples: They played him on first base

examples.definition: exhaust by allowing to pull on the line
examples: play a hooked fish

examples.definition: make bets
examples: play the casinos in Trouville

examples.definition: move or seem to move quickly, lightly, or irregularly
examples: The spotlights played on the politicians

examples.definition: participate in games or sport
examples: We played hockey all afternoon
play cards
Pele played for the Brazilian teams in many important matches

examples.definition: perform music on (a musical instrument)
examples: He plays the flute
Can you play on this old recorder?

examples.definition: perform on a certain location
examples: The prodigy played Carnegie Hall at the age of 16
She has been playing on Broadway for years

examples.definition: play on an instrument
examples: The band played all night long

examples.definition: pretend to be somebody in the framework of a game or playful activity
examples: Let's play like I am mommy

examples.definition: put (a card or piece) into play during a game, or act strategically as if in a card game
examples: He is playing his cards close to his chest
The Democrats still have some cards to play before they will concede the electoral victory

examples.definition: shoot or hit in a particular manner
examples: She played a good backhand last night

examples.definition: use or move
examples: I had to play my queen

examples.definition: use to one's advantage
examples: She plays on her clients' emotions

examples.definition: utilization or exercise
examples: the play of the imagination
